org.joda.pa.convert

Interface StringConverter


  • public interface StringConverter
    Interface defining conversion to and from a standard format String.

    The purpose of this package is to provide round-trip conversion to and from a string. No mechanism is provided for controlling the format of the output string.

    This is an interface and must be implemented with care. Implementations must be immutable and thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object convertFromString(Class<?> cls, String str)
      Converts the specified object from a String.
      String convertToString(Object object)
      Converts the specified object to a String.
      Class<?> getEffectiveType()
      Gets the effective type that the converter works on.

    • Method Detail

      • convertToString

        String convertToString(Object object)
        Converts the specified object to a String.

        Each unique state of the object must be represented by a unique string. This permits the conversion to be fully round-trip.

        Parameters:
        object - the object to convert, not null
        Returns:
        the converted string, may be null but generally not

      • convertFromString

        Object convertFromString(Class<?> cls,
                         String str)
        Converts the specified object from a String.

        Each standard format string corresponds to a unique state of the object. This permits the conversion to be fully round-trip.

        Parameters:
        cls - the class to convert to, not null
        str - the string to convert, not null
        Returns:
        the converted object, may be null but generally not

      • getEffectiveType

        Class<?> getEffectiveType()
        Gets the effective type that the converter works on.

        For example, if a class declares both @FromString and @ToString then the effective type of the converter is that class. If a subclass is queried for a converter, then the effective type is that of the superclass.

        Returns:
        the effective type
